title: Formula for Gravitational Potential Energy Converted to Power
text: $$P=ρghQ$$ where P is the power in watts (W), ρ is the density of water (1000 kg/m³), g is the acceleration due to gravity $$(9.81$$ m/s²), $$h$$ is the height (150 $$m$$ in this case), and Q is the flow rate (650 m³/s).

title: Calculate the Power
text: Substitute the values into the formula and calculate the power P in MW. (round to the nearest integer)
